title: Ride easy: reimagining Chennai’s future rail networks
content: For nearly three decades, very few improvements were made to the primary urban-suburban rail network of Chennai. Although the MRTS and Metro Rail were introduced, the Metro has become more popular due to its superior services. Now, it seems that for the first time, there appears to be a focused effort to improve rail services in Chennai. Along with enhancements to the Metro, will the city have an enviable rail service in a decade?

content: What are the situations in which countries can close their airspace? Are only military planes banned? What happens to civilian flights? After Operation Sindoor, are Indian planes now being allowed in Pakistan and vice-versa?

content: The nurse was removing paediatric venflon from the baby’s hand when she mistakenly cut off the tip of its right thumb; the baby was then taken to the Government Stanley Hospital in Chennai where doctors performed surgery; Vellore Collector has ordered an inquiry into the incident

content: With no significant weather system over the Bay of Bengal, Chennai too may begin to experience a mild increase in maximum temperature from Sunday

content: Speaking to the office-bearers from PMK strongholds such as Dharmapuri, Salem, Erode, Namakkal and Kallakurichi districts, Dr. Anbumani urged them to undertake a membership drive in the next three weeks and said that that he would soon take out a yatra across Tamil Nadu

title: Large crowd gathers to greet Chief Minister Stalin at roadshow in Madurai
content: He interacts with supporters during 20-km event, unveils life-size bronze statue of former Madurai Mayor S. Muthu; he will address the DMK’s general council meeting at Uthangudi today

content: Becomes fifth consecutive IPS officer to hold the post in an officiating capacity; SP chief Akhilesh Yadav questions move

content: According to officials, it is designed primarily for internal use, the Map View application showcases live updates of ongoing underground cable laying activities across Karnataka.

content: Blaming the government for its haste in releasing the results early, they demand that action against teachers be dropped and re-evaluation fee collected from students refunded

content: Most agents still use personal scooters or rent electric vehicles which are unsafe, especially on flooded roads

title: Karnataka: State police chief asks personnel to refrain from random vehicle checks
content: Guidelines come in the wake of two recent incidents in Mandya and Davangere where random checks led to deaths

title: Bamboo and kendu power to the people
content: Those living in the forest villages of Odisha’s Kalahandi district, mostly tribal, are coming together to assert their rights over the forest provided to them by law, but often not claimed and sometimes denied. Satyasundar Barik finds that they are directly negotiating with traders to create a source of income without government go-betweens

title: KSRTC launches weekend package tour to Srirangapatna, Melukote from Bengaluru
content: The service began on May 31, and will be operational every Saturday and Sunday, according to officials.

title: No one trusts Bandi Sanjay’s comments on Congress: TPCC leader
content: Mr. Dayakar questioned the BJP’s credibility, pointing out that the party has failed to address the people’s concerns and has instead resorted to spreading false propaganda

title: Karnataka tightens COTPA rules; penalty for violations, legal age for purchasing tobacco products raised
content: The amended Act — the Cigarettes and Other Tobacco Products (Prohibition of Advertisement and Regulation of Trade and Commerce, Production, Supply and Distribution) (Karnataka Amendment) Act, 2024 — was published in the Karnataka Gazette on May 30

title: India engages U.S. in plans to ‘grey list’ Pakistan at FATF session
content: Foreign Secretary Misri concludes three-day visit, discusses trade and defence deals with his counterparts

title: As deaths in Karnataka touch four, Health Dept. issues advisory on COVID-19 surveillance, safety
content: An 84-year-old in Bengaluru, a 70-year-old in Belagavi, and a 63-year-old in Mysuru, who also had several comorbid conditions and developed COVID, succumbed to the disease on May 17, 26, and 25 respectively.

title: Thailand’s Opal Suchata Chuangsri crowned Miss World 2025 in a dazzling grand finale in Hyderabad
content: The month-long celebration in Telangana featured historical tours, cultural showcases and a global platform for advocacy and empowerment

title: Government employees should not avail of Ladkhi Bahin scheme: Maharashtra Revenue Minister
content: The government would recover the money in such instances, and some departments had already commenced inquiries, Chandrashekhar Bawankule said

title: Hyderabad to adopt ‘land pooling’ and Local Area Development Planning to revolutionise HMDA functioning
content: LADP envisions intensive planning inside each grid, consisting of 250 to 300 acres of land, leading to more organised development; it will also help planners to earmark spaces for public utilities, parks, schools and hospitals, besides providing pedestrian infrastructure, HMDA Commissioner said

title: Lord Jagannath’s Kolkata chariot to glide on Sukhoi tyres
content: Kolkata's Iskcon Rath Yatra chariot, carrying Lord Jagannath, will roll on new Sukhoi fighter jet tyres, replacing the old Boeing 747 tyres. This change comes after a steering snag last year and a two-decade search for suitable replacements. The MRF-manufactured tyres will enhance manoeuvrability, safety, and stability, especially on Kolkata's tram-tracked roads, ensuring a smoother Yatra experience.

title: Odisha engineer held on retirement day for assets worth Rs 15 cr, 483% more than income
content: Baikunthanath Sarangi, a chief engineer, was arrested on his retirement day for amassing disproportionate assets exceeding Rs 15 crore. He was caught on video throwing cash during a vigilance raid. Searches revealed multiple properties, significant cash holdings, and investments. In a separate case, searches were conducted on N Dillip Kumar Choudhury, an assistant executive engineer, for similar allegations.

title: ‘You can take Krishna’s army but not Krishna’: Tej Pratap's emotional note for brother Tejashwi
content: Amidst a family feud, Tej Pratap Yadav expressed loyalty to his brother Tejashwi, likening their bond to Krishna and Arjun. This follows Lalu Prasad Yadav's expulsion of Tej Pratap from the party and family due to alleged misconduct. Tej Pratap also appealed to his parents for support after the expulsion.

title: 'He listened to his heart': De Villiers on why Kohli walked away from Tests
content: In a shocking announcement, Virat Kohli has retired from Test cricket after a stellar 14-year career. AB de Villiers, a close friend, believes Kohli followed his heart. Kohli, 36, played 123 Tests, amassing 9,230 runs with 30 centuries. De Villiers acknowledged the void Kohli leaves, emphasizing his significant legacy in red-ball cricket.

title: Who is Megha Vemuri, Indian-American student banned from MIT ceremony
content: Megha Vemuri, MIT's Class of 2025 president, was banned from her graduation after delivering a pro-Palestine speech criticizing the university's ties with Israel. MIT cited disruption of an official event as the reason, leading to online backlash and Vemuri deleting her LinkedIn profile. The incident highlights the ongoing tensions surrounding campus activism and free speech related to the Israel-Gaza conflict.

title: ‘Fed her sedative-laced laddoo’: Taekwondo player gang-raped at Kanpur ashram
content: A national-level Taekwondo player has accused four individuals, including temple priests, of gang-raping her inside an ashram in Kanpur's Govind Nagar. The survivor alleges she was drugged with a sedative-laced sweet before the assault, which occurred in January. The accused also allegedly made an obscene video of her and threatened to release it.

title: PSG UCL celebrations turn tragic: Two dead, 559 arrested across France
content: Paris Saint-Germain fans celebrated their Champions League victory, resulting in nearly 600 arrests due to clashes with police near the Champs-Elysees. A car incident in Grenoble injured four celebrating fans. Despite the unrest, joyous fans sang and danced, celebrating PSG's historic win. President Macron will host the team, and a victory parade is planned on the Champs-Elysees.

title: Microsoft exec has a message for coders, after laying off 2k+ engineers
content: Despite recent layoffs impacting software engineers, Microsoft's CPO, Aparna Chennapragada, defends the importance of computer science education. She argues AI is simply another layer of abstraction, transforming roles into "software operators" rather than eliminating them. As Microsoft invests heavily in AI, project managers will also adapt, focusing on editing and refining AI-generated ideas.

title: Watch: IndiGo pilot shares moment of colleague’s first flight with his parents onboard
content: An IndiGo pilot, Captain Aravind, experienced a heartwarming maiden scheduled flight from Bengaluru to Thiruvananthapuram, celebrated by his parents who were passengers on board. Captain Pradeep Krishnan shared the touching moment on Instagram, showcasing the mid-air announcement and the cabin's applause. Aravind expressed gratitude to his parents for their unwavering support, making the flight a memorable milestone.

title: Gautam Adani says 'Adani Group has become more unbreakable & resilient' amid challenges, scrutiny
content: Gautam Adani asserts the Adani Group's resilience and strategic adaptation amidst acquisitions and scrutiny, planning a $15–20 billion investment over five years. Despite facing allegations from Hindenburg Research and US authorities, the group has reduced debt, attracted investments, and reported record earnings. Adani emphasizes strong governance and compliance, highlighting expansion across various sectors and contributions to India's ambitions.

title: 'We all rise above party politics': Manish Tewari on India's stand against terror
content: Amidst Operation Sindoor, Congress leader Manish Tewari, speaking from Addis Ababa, voiced support for India's firm stance against terrorism, echoing sentiments from other Congress members. This unity emerges even as party president Kharge criticizes the government's handling of recent events. Tewari highlighted Ethiopia's backing of India following the Pahalgam attack, emphasizing strengthened ties and global solidarity against cross-border terrorism.

title: WhatsApp will not work on these iPhones and Android smartphones from today
content: Starting June 1, 2025, WhatsApp will discontinue support for older iPhones lacking iOS 15.1 and Android devices below version 5.1. This update, delayed from May 5th, aims to enhance security and performance by leveraging newer OS features. Affected users are advised to upgrade their devices, explore alternative messaging apps, or back up their chats to avoid service disruptions.

title: 'Planned systematic attack': B'desh starts trial of Sheikh Hasina
content: Sheikh Hasina's trial commenced in Bangladesh, accusing her of orchestrating a violent crackdown on 2024 protests that resulted in numerous deaths. The prosecution presented evidence of a coordinated attack, while Hasina, in exile, dismissed the charges as politically motivated. Simultaneously, Bangladesh's Supreme Court lifted a ban on Jamaat-e-Islami, adding another layer of complexity to the nation's political landscape.

title: GST collections cross Rs 2 lakh crore for 2nd month in a row
content: GST collections have surpassed Rs 2 lakh crore for the second consecutive month in May 2025, reaching Rs 2.01 lakh crore, a 16.4% increase year-on-year, according to the Ministry of Finance. This follows a record high of Rs 2.37 lakh crore in April.

title: Elderly couple ‘abandoned’ in their Gurgaon flat for 3 years, community steps in
content: In Gurgaon's Ridgewood Estate, concerned neighbors alerted authorities to the plight of an elderly couple allegedly abandoned by their son living abroad. The Haryana Human Rights Commission intervened, ordering a comprehensive assessment after residents reported the couple's distress and lack of proper care.

title: Flash floods, waterlogging hit Agartala, life disrupted; IMD issues heavy rainfall alert
content: Agartala grapples with severe flash floods following incessant monsoon rains, disrupting normal life and prompting the displacement of over 6000 residents. The Chief Minister is monitoring the situation, while the administration has opened relief camps. IMD forecasts continued heavy rainfall, raising concerns about further flooding, landslides, and potential disruptions across Tripura.

title: 'Why did we have to wait for CDS to speak from Singapore?': Cong slams Centre over jets
content: Jairam Ramesh, a Congress MP, raised concerns regarding the government's handling of Operation Sindoor disclosures. He questioned why CDS General Anil Chauhan revealed key details abroad first. Ramesh felt the Defence Minister should have informed Parliament. He compared this to Vajpayee's transparency during the Kargil conflict.

title: 21 killed, 175 wounded during aid distribution in Gaza
content: A tragic incident unfolded in the Gaza Strip as at least 21 individuals lost their lives and 175 sustained injuries while seeking aid from an Israeli-backed foundation. Witnesses reported Israeli forces opened fire on crowds near the distribution site, though the Israeli military acknowledged only firing warning shots.

title: Canadian man wins jackpot, gives $3.6m to girlfriend, who leaves him for someone else
content: Lawrence Campbell, a Winnipeg man, is suing his former girlfriend, Krystal McKay, after she allegedly cashed in his $3.6 million lottery ticket and disappeared. Campbell claims he entrusted McKay with the ticket because he lacked ID, but she severed ties shortly after receiving the winnings. He alleges she ghosted him and obtained a protection order, while McKay denies the accusations and is preparing her legal response.

title: Delhi HC upholds Army officer’s termination for refusing to attend religious parade
content: The Delhi High Court upheld the 2017 termination of an Army officer who refused to participate in regimental religious parades due to his Christian faith. The court emphasized that the armed forces are united by their uniform, not divided by religion, and the officer's behavior was against the secular norms of the Army.

title: Punjab Kings' biggest challenge: How to survive 'possessed' Bumrah's 24 balls
content: Jasprit Bumrah rarely shows emotion on the pitch and seldom celebrates a wicket, but in the IPL 2025 Eliminator, he looked like a man possessed. He finished with 1/27 in four overs — below par by his standards — yet Washington Sundar’s wicket turned the tide in MI’s favour. In a world where bowlers get their due beyond talk shows and podcasts, Bumrah might well have pipped Rohit for the Player of the Match award.

title: 'Free the brave!': Dutch politician backs arrested influencer Sharmistha Panoli
content: Dutch politician Geert Wilders has voiced his support for Sharmishta Panoli, an Indian influencer arrested for allegedly making communal remarks in a social media video. Wilders condemned the arrest as a disgrace to freedom of speech, urging Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi to intervene.

title: Salesman slapped, thrashed with belt for charging Rs 10 extra on beer in Noida
content: In Greater Noida, a liquor salesman, Manish Kumar, alleges that excise inspector Chandra Shekhar assaulted him for overcharging customers. Kumar claims he was slapped, beaten with a belt, and detained at the excise office. His family protested after police refused to register a complaint.

title: How Delhi's summer is changing: 3-fold rise in May rainfall in 75 years
content: Delhi recorded its wettest May since 1901, reflecting a sharp rise in rainfall over decades—tripling since 1951. Recent years saw an average of 95.7mm rain, yet temperatures remain unchanged. Experts link the trend to increased thunderstorms and moisture from global warming. Rising humidity heightens health risks, power demand, and infrastructure stress, signaling a significant climate shift.

title: Man taking pictures with friends falls into sea in Mumbai, dies
content: Tragedy struck Juhu Koliwada as Anil Arjun Rajput, 20, drowned near Juhu Jetty. He was reportedly taking pictures with friends when the incident occurred. The Mumbai Fire Brigade received the alert at 8:17 pm. Lifeguards rescued Rajput and rushed him to Cooper Hospital. Sadly, doctors pronounced him dead on arrival. The incident is under investigation.

title: 'Pak DGMO called but problem with hotline': All-party delegation on how truce was reached
content: An all-party delegation revealed that the India-Pakistan truce on May 10 was initiated by Pakistan, dismissing claims of third-party mediation. JDU MP Sanjay Kumar Jha stated that the Pakistani DGMO's call for a ceasefire faced hotline issues, leading to communication through their embassy in India.

title: Sikkim bridge washes away as Teesta River swells amid heavy rainfall
content: Heavy rainfall in North Sikkim has triggered landslides and caused the Teesta River to wash away a key section of the under-construction Sankalang Bridge, severing links to remote areas. A red alert is in place as rescue teams search for nine missing tourists after a vehicle plunged into the river. Multiple properties were damaged, and travel advisories have been issued.

title: ‘Secularism must be two-way street’: Kalyan slams student's arrest by WB Police
content: Pawan Kalyan has denounced the arrest of a Symbiosis law student for allegedly hurting religious sentiments through a viral video during ‘Operation Sindoor’. He criticized the silence surrounding alleged blasphemy by TMC leaders and MPs, accusing them of mocking Sanatana Dharma. The student was remanded to judicial custody, and Symbiosis International University suspended her, distancing itself from her comments.

title: Minor rape survivor waits for hours in ambulance outside Patna hospital
content: A minor rape survivor, referred to Patna Medical College Hospital (PMCH) from Muzaffarpur, faced a harrowing four-hour wait in an ambulance due to bed unavailability. This incident has exposed the dire state of Bihar's public health system.

title: India lost jets but changed tactics to hit Pakistan hard: CDS
content: CDS General Anil Chauhan acknowledged India's initial fighter jet losses during Operation Sindoor against terror hubs in Pakistan and PoK on May 7. He refuted Pakistan's claims of shooting down six IAF aircraft, including Rafales. India adapted its tactics, inflicting significant damage on Pakistani airbases deep inside the border before a ceasefire was established.

title: NEET UG 2025 answer key expected soon: Check steps to download & important details here
content: The NEET UG 2025 provisional answer key is expected to be released soon on the official NTA website, neet.nta.nic.in. Over 20 lakh candidates appeared for the May 4 exam. Once published, students can estimate scores and raise objections during a limited challenge window. Final results and All India Ranks will follow after expert review.

title: India's top-10 most valued firms add Rs 1 lakh crore in market value
content: Despite a muted equity market trend, four of the top 10 Indian companies, including LIC, SBI, HDFC Bank and Bharti Airtel, collectively added Rs 1,01,369.5 crore to their market valuation last week. However, six firms, such as Reliance and TCS, experienced a combined decrease of Rs 34,852.35 crore.

title: 'Dear mom & dad ... ': Tej Pratap pleads for love, blames ‘greedy people’ for rift with family
content: Following his expulsion from the RJD and estrangement from his father, Lalu Prasad Yadav, Tej Pratap Yadav has publicly appealed to his parents for their love and trust, blaming political conspiracies for his downfall. Lalu expelled Tej Pratap for allegedly violating moral values and harming the family's principles after a controversial social media post.

title: Watch: Imagine Dragons' Dan Reynolds kisses Palestinian flag on stage
content: Imagine Dragons' Dan Reynolds ignited controversy by kissing a Palestinian flag during a Milan concert, sparking accusations of supporting extremism and betraying pro-Israel fans. The act drew both outrage and support, highlighting the band's complicated history with the Israeli-Palestinian conflict, including a previous performance in Tel Aviv and waving a Ukrainian flag during the same concert.

title: Chirag Paswan to contest Bihar polls from general seat? What LJP said
content: Chirag Paswan's potential entry into Bihar's assembly elections gains traction as his party suggests he contest from a general seat, deviating from his past Lok Sabha campaigns in reserved constituencies. Arun Bharti, LJP (Ram Vilas) Bihar in-charge, emphasized that Paswan represents the aspirations of all Bihar, not just a specific community.

title: Valmik Thapar walked with tigers, now he rests
content: Valmik Thapar, a renowned conservationist, author, and documentarian, passed away at 73 after dedicating 50 years to tiger conservation in India. His encounter with Fateh Singh Rathore in Ranthambhore ignited a lifelong mission to protect tigers, leading to the establishment of the Ranthambhore Foundation and influencing national wildlife policy.

title: Mysterious space object sends signals to Earth every 44 mins, scientists baffled
content: Astronomers in Australia have detected a mysterious cosmic object, ASKAP J1832-0911, emitting radio and X-ray bursts every 44 minutes, an unprecedented occurrence. This long-period transient defies existing stellar remnant theories with its rhythmic pattern. The discovery, made using ASKAP and Chandra, may indicate a new class of celestial bodies, prompting further investigation into its origin and implications for space science.

title: Watch: Goa crow shows off football skills, internet wants to sign him up
content: A remarkable video from South Goa has captured the hearts of social media users, showcasing an extraordinary football match between a young boy and a crow. The bird skillfully uses its beak to pass the ball back and forth, creating an adorable and captivating display of interspecies teamwork.

title: Russia an 'immediate' threat, China a 'sophisticated' one: UK defence review warns
content: The UK's defence review identifies Russia as an immediate threat and China as a persistent challenge, drawing lessons from the Ukraine war. Britain faces a new era of warfare with emerging technologies.

title: Trump crackdown on student visas: Here’s what Indians are doing
content: Amidst stricter student visa regulations and political uncertainties in the US, Indian students and their families are increasingly exploring the EB-5 visa option for permanent residency. Applications from F-1 visa holders have surged, driven by concerns over potential disruptions to their academic pursuits and future prospects.

title: Watch: Guwahati submerged as heavy rain causes severe waterlogging
content: Guwahati experienced severe waterlogging due to incessant rainfall, leading to rescue operations by various agencies. The city recorded its highest-ever May rainfall, intensifying the impact of a depression over Bangladesh and Meghalaya. Tragically, several fatalities were reported across northeastern states, including Assam, due to floods and landslides, prompting ongoing evacuation and relief efforts.

title: Doctors treat patients under mobile flashlights after power outage in Telangana hospital
content: Following a viral video showing patients treated under mobile phone lights during a power outage, the in-charge superintendent of Zaheerabad area hospital, V Sridhar Kumar, has been suspended. An inquiry revealed a delay in activating the backup generator, causing disruption in emergency services.

title: Watch: Chairs fly as wedding guests brawl over cooler in Jhansi
content: A wedding celebration in Jhansi descended into chaos when a dispute over a cooler ignited a violent clash between the bride's and groom's families. The argument began when guests from the groom's side sat in front of a cooler meant for the wedding couple, leading to objections from the bride's family.

title: EA Sports College Football 26 gameplay officially revealed in new trailer
content: college football 26 will include thousands of real college players and over 300 real-world coaches . the game also has added over 2700 new plays, which EA Sports says will make for "authentic college football like never before" the series started in 1993 with the release of Bill Walsh College Football on the Sega Genesis .

title: Manny Pacquiao is back, but why is he getting a title shot?
content: Manny Pacquiao returns to the ring for the first time in almost four years . the 46-year-old is boxing's only eight-division champion . he last fought in august 2021 when he suffered a loss by unanimous decision to Yordenis Ugas .

title: Cowboys' Dak Prescott and fiancée Sarah Jane Ramos welcome new daughter
content: dak Prescott's fiancée, Sarah Jane Ramos, gave birth to a baby girl on may 22 . the couple named their daughter Aurora Rayne . "i love you [Sarah Jane] and the family we've created," Prescott wrote .

title: Stanley Cup Final odds: McDavid is Conn Smythe fave in Panthers rematch
content: the Edmonton Oilers beat the Florida Panthers 3-0 in the last year's Stanley Cup final . Connor McDavid and the Oilers won the next three to force a Game 7 . the oilers defeated their in-state rivals, the Tampa Bay Lightning in the first round, the Toronto Maple Leafs in a seven-game second round .

title: F1 25 review -- A familiar package with a shining, compelling story mode
content: the introduction of the Braking Point story mode into the series has been interesting to watch . fans of the series scorned it for using up resources that could've gone into the more traditional modes . it's a trend that EA Sports F1 25 will likely continue .

title: Free agency and draft plans for Stars, Hurricanes, every other eliminated team
content: the 2024-25 NHL regular season is over and the playoffs are underway . a breakdown of the biggest keys this offseason and realistic expectations for next season . more teams will be added to this story as they are eliminated .

title: 2026 recruiting class rankings: Notre Dame pushes closer to the top spot
content: Notre Dame has pushed its way into the no. 2 slot of our 2026 class rankings . the Fighting Illini shook off the loss of ESPN 300 CB Victor Singleton quite well . Nasir Rankin , a top-10 athlete in the ESPN 300, is an early in-state priority .
